title: Document Todo.from_dict None handling is correct
problem_summary: Issue #2856 claimed that str(data.get('created_at') or '') with None returns 'None' string. This was based on a misunderstanding of Python operator precedence. The current code is CORRECT because 'or' has LOWER precedence than function call, so str(None or '') = str('') = '', not str(None) or '' = 'None' or '' = 'None'.
resolution: NO_FIX_NEEDED - The current code already handles None correctly. The issue reporter was confused about Python operator precedence.

tdd_results.tests_added: 6 tests added to document correct None handling behavior

recommendation: Close issue #2856 as 'works as intended' with added regression tests for documentation.
